sentences.en: Before 1933, by contrast, he was a prolific author.
sentences.cn: 相较而言, 1933年之前, 他算是一名多产的作者.

sentences.en: Crane was a prolific writer throughout his short life.
sentences.cn: 作家克雷恩在其短暂的一生中创作了许多作品.

sentences.en: During the Seventies, Rundgren was astonishingly prolific.
sentences.cn: 20世纪70年代，伦德格伦的作品多得惊人。
韩德尔丰富的歌剧作品

sentences.en: He was as indifferent to his as they were prolific.
sentences.cn: 他对于他那多产的创作力漠不关心.

sentences.en: It is a period prolific of great poets.
sentences.cn: 这是伟大诗人辈出的时代.

sentences.en: Meyers is a diligent and prolific worker.
sentences.cn: 迈耶斯是个勤奋多产的工人。

sentences.en: one of the most prolific periods in her career
sentences.cn: 她的创作生涯中成果最丰的时期之一

sentences.en: She is a prolific writer of novels and short stories.
sentences.cn: 她是一位多产的作家，写了很多小说和短篇故事。

sentences.en: The area is prolific in the production of fruit.
The last few pages of the document are prolific of mistakes.
sentences.cn: 这个文件的最后几页错误很多.

sentences.en: The most prolific of the debunkers of the plutocracy was Gustavus Myers.
sentences.cn: 揭发富豪统治集团的作家中,最多产的是古斯塔夫斯·迈尔斯.

sentences.en: The mountainous area is prolific in valuable minerals.
sentences.cn: 这一山区有丰富的宝贵矿石.

sentences.en: They are prolific breeders, with many hens laying up to six eggs.
sentences.cn: 他们都是多产的饲养员，养的母鸡很多都可以下6个蛋之多。

sentences.en: We do not know that even the most prolific area is fully stocked with specific forms.
sentences.cn: 即使是最繁盛的地域,是否已经充满了物种,我们并不知道.

trans.tran_cn: （艺术家、作家等）多产的，众多的，富饶的，（植物、动物等）丰硕的
trans.tran_en: a prolific artist, writer etc produces many works of art, books etc
